facts.fact_text: UK car registrations rose by 3.4% in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: New car sales in the UK rose by 3.4% from the previous year to 144,127 units in January of 2026, slowing from the 3.9% increase in the previous month.

facts.fact_text: Plug-in hybrid electric vehicle registrations soared by 47.3% to 18,557 units.

evidences.evidence_text: Registrations for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles soared (47.3% to 18,557) to mark over 12% of total registrations.

facts.fact_text: Hybrid electric vehicle registrations increased by 4.8% to 19,197 units.

evidences.evidence_text: A softer increase was noted for hybrid electric vehicles (4.8% to 19,197)

facts.fact_text: Battery electric vehicle registrations were steady at 0.1% to 29,654 units.

evidences.evidence_text: Registrations of battery electric vehicles were steady (0.1% to 29,654), over 20% of the market share.

facts.fact_text: Petrol engine vehicle sales fell by 1.9% to 68,757 units.

evidences.evidence_text: In turn, sales fell for petrol engine vehicles (-1.9% to 68,757).

evidence.evidence_text: New car sales in the UK rose by 3.4% from the previous year to 144,127 units in January of 2026, slowing from the 3.9% increase in the previous month.
Registrations for plug-in hybrid electric vehicles soared (47.3% to 18,557) to mark over 12% of total registrations.
A softer increase was noted for hybrid electric vehicles (4.8% to 19,197)
Registrations of battery electric vehicles were steady (0.1% to 29,654), over 20% of the market share.
In turn, sales fell for petrol engine vehicles (-1.9% to 68,757).
